text: can display table directly R chunk, simple table recommend use kable knitr package. ensure proper representation table, make sure add format HTML kable call: knitr::kable(format = "html"). can also set global option slides using options(knitr.table.format = "html"). kable function can also help format output format, like formatting numbers, changing column names adding caption. can see information kable can . Simple kable table:  flexibility advanced table style refer R packages like GT static tables DT need interactivity.
code: head(aus_displ) |>    knitr::kable(format = "html",                col.names = c("Country of origin", "Country of asylum",                             "Population type", "Number of people"),                caption = "Displaced population in Australia | 2021")

title: Create UNHCR HTML Presentation
text: simple tables, included series classes can applied kable output format. Simply add required class names table.attr parameter kable call, don’t forget use \ escape quote character. following classes available: .table: initiate possibility stylize table provide base style. class mandatory. .table-blue: add light blue background alternate rows. .table-grey: add light grey background alternate rows. .table-narrow: .table set, width 100%. .table-narrow allows fit width content. .table-noborder: remove borders table. Kable table UNHCR classes:
code: head(aus_displ) |>    knitr::kable(format = "html",                col.names = c("Country of origin", "Country of asylum", "Population type", "Number of people"),                caption = "Displaced population in Australia | 2021",                table.attr = "class=\"table  table-blue table-narrow table-noborder\"")

title: Create UNHCR HTML Presentation
text: creation charts, recommend use unhcrthemes provides ggplot2 theme set colour palettes making charts graphics based UNHCR Data Visualization Guidelines. charts made unhcrthemes perfectly integrated unhcrdown::html_slides presentation fully aligned UNHCR brand. Inserting plot easy table requires lines code. information make plot using unhcrthemes please refer package documentation UNHCR Data Visualization Platform R tutorials. unhcrthemes plot example:  Getting plot right always easy, can control plots playing individual chunk options like fig.retina .width (plus fig.width fig.height). Often requires trial error, check Hadley/Garrett’s recommended ggplot2 chunk options guidance. Show code alongside resulting plot: nice tip purpose teaching use fig.show ref.label code chunk options avoid repeating code. Chunk showing code: {r plot-name, fig.show = 'hide'} Chunk showing plot: {r ref.label = 'plot-name', echo = FALSE}
code: ```{r, fig.showtext = TRUE, fig.retina = 4, out.width="60%", fig.height=5} library(tidyverse) library(scales) library(unhcrthemes)  idp_total_sex <- idp |>   group_by(year, sex) |>   summarise(idp = sum(idp, na.rm = TRUE) / 1e6) |>   ungroup()  ggplot(idp_total_sex) +   geom_col(aes(x = year, y = idp, fill = sex),     width = 0.8,     position = position_dodge(width = 0.9)   ) +   scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = "pal_unhcr") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +   labs(     title = "Globalement IDP displacement | 2010 - 2020",     y = "Number of people (in million)",     caption = "Source: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder\n© UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency"   ) +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = pretty_breaks(10)) +   theme_unhcr(grid = "Y", axis_title = "y") ```
